byline.contributor: Sandra E. Garcia reported from Santo Domingo, and Azam Ahmed from Mexico City. Paulina Villegas contributed reporting from Mexico City.
byline.original: By SANDRA E. GARCIA and AZAM AHMED

abstract: Specter of mass deportation of Haitian immigrants from Dominican Republic due to expiration of deadline for illegal migrant workers to register with government fails to materialize; advocates say some Haitians have been detained, and residents report many Haitians have gone into hiding out of fear of arbitrary deportation, fear even some Dominicans share.
lead_paragraph: The expected mass deportation of Haitian immigrants in the Dominican Republic failed to materialize in the two days after the government’s deadline for them to normalize their status.

headline.main: Dominican Deadline Passes Without Mass Expulsion of Haitian Migrants
headline.print_headline: Dominican Deadline Passes Without Mass Expulsion of Haitian Migrants

snippet: The expected mass deportation of Haitian immigrants in the Dominican Republic failed to materialize in the two days after the government’s deadline for them to normalize their status.
